author: parithosh
content:
Could be that teku/lodestar isnt returning something that fulfils this?
https://lighthouse-book.sigmaprime.io/checkpoint-sync.html#alignment-requirements

we usually use checkpointz and that ensures everyone is compatible. I guess an easy check to see if its a real bug is to manually get the state that you're sure will pass the check (check that link) and pass it with the `--checkpoint-state` flag

author: barnabasbusa
content: checkpointz doesn't yet support dencun tho. So have to use other beacon nodes.

content: <@360491619402776577> are you absolutely sure that master geth is compatible with go-kzg? I am blocked on prysm because of all the cryptographic library changes and inter dependencies with geth. I see geth tries to import go-kzg-4844 version 0.2.0 but I read the logs of the go kzg repo and I see that there are some big endian changes tagged with 0.3.0. Perhaps <@427491045308235776> may want to clarify this? which version of go-kzg would be safe to use? I don't want to become a specialist and spend time reading the crypto libraries git histories.
